name: createManagedService
description:
Creates a Managed Service. Linode Managed will begin monitoring this
service and reporting and attempting to resolve any Issues.

This command can only be accessed by the unrestricted users of an account.

body.description: Information about the service to monitor.

ManagedService.description: A service that Linode is monitoring as part of your Managed services. If issues are detected with this service, a ManagedIssue will be opened and, optionally, Linode special forces will attempt to resolve the Issue.

address.description:
The URL at which this Service is monitored.

URL parameters such as `?no-cache=1` are preserved.

URL fragments/anchors such as `#monitor` are **not** preserved.

body.description: What to expect to find in the response body for the Service to be considered up.

consultation_group.description: The group of ManagedContacts who should be notified or consulted with when an Issue is detected.

created.description: When this Managed Service was created.

credentials.description: An array of ManagedCredential IDs that should be used when attempting to resolve issues with this Service.

label.description: The label for this Service. This is for display purposes only.

notes.description: Any information relevant to the Service that Linode special forces should know when attempting to resolve Issues.

region.description: The Region in which this Service is located. This is required if address is a private IP, and may not be set otherwise.

status.description: The current status of this Service.

timeout.description: How long to wait, in seconds, for a response before considering the Service to be down.

updated.description: When this Managed Service was last updated.

$block: A service that Linode is monitoring as part of your Managed services. If issues are detected with this service, a ManagedIssue will be opened and, optionally, Linode special forces will attempt to resolve the Issue.

$ul: **address**: The URL at which this Service is monitored.
**body**: What to expect to find in the response body for the Service to be considered up.
**consultation_group**: The group of ManagedContacts who should be notified or consulted with when an Issue is detected.
**created**: When this Managed Service was created.
**credentials**: An array of ManagedCredential IDs that should be used when attempting to resolve issues with this Service.
**label**: The label for this Service. This is for display purposes only.
**notes**: Any information relevant to the Service that Linode special forces should know when attempting to resolve Issues.
**region**: The Region in which this Service is located. This is required if address is a private IP, and may not be set otherwise.
**status**: The current status of this Service.
**timeout**: How long to wait, in seconds, for a response before considering the Service to be down.
**updated**: When this Managed Service was last updated.
